meanings.definition: A person or thing that confines or restricts movement.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher was seen as one of the confiners of fun in the school.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the prison acted as effective confiners for the criminals.
meanings.sent3: The confiners of the bouncy castle were the mischievous kids who wanted to keep it all to themselves.
meanings.sent4: The confiners of the river were the steep cliffs that hemmed it in on both sides.
meanings.sent5: The confiners of the maze made it impossible for anyone to find their way out easily.

meanings.definition: A device or structure used to confine or enclose something.
meanings.sent1: The confiners of the document were the sturdy filing cabinet drawers.
meanings.sent2: The confiners of the chickens were the wire mesh fences in the coop.
meanings.sent3: The confiners of the cookies were the glass jar with a tight lid to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent4: The confiners of the jewels were the thick metal safe doors that kept them secure.
meanings.sent5: The confiners of the books were the wooden shelves that neatly held them in place.

meanings.definition: A person who keeps animals in confinement.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper was known as one of the confiners of the wild animals.
meanings.sent2: The confiners of the farm animals ensured they were well-fed and cared for.
meanings.sent3: The confiners of the pets made sure they had cozy beds and plenty of toys.
meanings.sent4: The confiners of the circus animals trained them with care and respect.
meanings.sent5: The confiners of the laboratory mice monitored their health and behavior closely.
